# Overview

In this lab, you'll learn to analyse Grit Scale data in R. We'll work through loading data, reverse-scoring questionnaire items, calculating subscales, creating visualisations, and writing up results.

## The Data Story

We've collected data using the Short Grit Scale (Grit-S):

- **120 university students** completed the 8-item Grit Scale
- Participants are either **First Year** or **Final Year** students
- The scale measures two subscales: Consistency of Interest and Perseverance of Effort

**Our research question**: Do grit scores differ between first-year and final-year students?

::: {.callout-note}
![](/assets/images/svg/brain.svg){width=20 style="float: left; margin-right: 10px;"}

## Learn More About the Grit Scale

Want to read the original research? [Access the source article](https://librarysearch.gold.ac.uk/permalink/f/igqbsh/TN_cdi_informaworld_taylorfrancis_310_1080_00223890802634290) through the Goldsmiths Library.
:::

## ![](/assets/images/svg/target.svg){width=24} Learning Objectives

By the end of this lab, you will be able to:

- Navigate RStudio and understand its four panes
- Load CSV data into R using `read_csv()`
- Reverse-score negatively worded questionnaire items (4 items: G1, G3, G5, G6)
- Calculate subscale scores (Consistency of Interest, Perseverance of Effort)
- Calculate descriptive statistics by group using `dplyr`
- Create boxplots using `ggplot2`
- Write an APA-style results paragraph

# Schedule

**Lab Time: 13:00 - 15:00**

| Time | Activity |
|------|----------|
| 13:00-13:10 | Part 1: What is R? + RStudio Tour |
| 13:10-13:20 | **Practice: WebR basics** |
| 13:20-13:35 | Part 2: Loading Data |
| 13:35-13:50 | **Practice: Data loading** |
| 13:50-14:05 | Part 3: Reverse Scoring |
| 14:05-14:20 | **Practice: Scoring** |
| 14:20-14:40 | Part 4: Descriptives & Visualisation |
| 14:40-14:55 | **Practice: Analysis + Write-Up** |
| 14:55-15:00 | Wrap-up |

# Key Concepts

## The Five Parts

| Part | Topic | Key Skills |
|------|-------|------------|
| 1 | RStudio Tour | Variables, vectors, functions, **download notebook** |
| 2 | Loading Data | `read_csv()`, `head()`, `str()`, `dim()` |
| 3 | Reverse Scoring | Formula: `6 - original` (4 items: G1, G3, G5, G6) |
| 4 | Descriptives & Plots | `group_by()`, `summarise()`, `ggplot()` boxplots |
| 5 | APA Write-Up | Reporting M, SD, n, proactive coding |

---

### RStudio Exercise

![](/assets/images/svg/laptop.svg){width=20} Download the exercise notebook to complete in RStudio Server:


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}

```{=html}
<button class="btn btn-warning btn-lg" onclick="
    async function downloadFile(event) {
      event.preventDefault();
      try {
        const response = await fetch('data:application/octet-stream;base64,');
        if (!response.ok) throw new Error('Network response failed');
        const blob = await response.blob();
        const blobUrl = window.URL.createObjectURL(blob);
        const a = document.createElement('a');
        a.href = blobUrl;
        a.download = 'lab1-exercise.qmd';
        a.style.display = 'none';
        document.body.appendChild(a);
        a.dispatchEvent(new MouseEvent('click'));
        document.body.removeChild(a);
        setTimeout(() => {
          window.URL.revokeObjectURL(blobUrl);
        }, 100);
        return false;
      } catch (error) {
        console.error('Download failed:', error);
        alert('Download failed. Please try again.');
      }
    }
    downloadFile(event);
  "><i class="fa fa-download"></i> Download Exercise (.qmd)</button>
```

:::
:::
